alert.note: Alert for Escambia (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 14 at 3:07PM CDT until July 18 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Alabama, including the following county, Escambia. * WHEN...Until 615 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding is ongoing across low-lying and poor drainage areas in the city of Brewton in Escambia County. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. Ponding of water is occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 305 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Brewton, East Brewton, Pollard, Riverview, Rock Hill, Dixonville, Kirkland, Roberts, Hammac and Foshee. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
